definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
the enemy of the people/the class enemy (Marxism)

sentences.english: I probably would have been public enemy No. 1.
sentences.chinese: 我也许会成为头号公敌。

sentences.english: With this just remember the hollywood movie i ROBOT.
sentences.chinese: 看了这个后，一定要记住好莱坞电影《机械公敌》。

sentences.english: They attacked him as "a running dog for the government" and "the enemy of netizens".
sentences.chinese: 他们抨击他为“政府的走狗”“网民的公敌”。

sentences.english: "I feel like I am an enemy of the state, " Guo said.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉自己像是一个全民公敌。

definition: lit. target of a multitude of arrows (idiom); the butt of public criticism/attacked on all sides
a matter for ridicule/an object of ridicule/laughingstock
the masses rise to attack it (idiom); Everyone is against the idea./universally abhorrent
sb or sth detested by all/target of scorn/anathema/cf. 老鼠過街，人人喊打|老鼠过街，人人喊打[lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3]
variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
to spit on and curse/to revile
(of enemies) cannot live under the same sky/absolutely irreconcilable
